features: A professional-grade wearable microphone designed to perform excellently in any broadcast application
The 3.5mm TRS connector pairs perfectly with the RODE Wireless GO and most recording devices with a 3.5mm TRS microphone input
Features a discreet 4. 5mm omnidirectional microphone that delivers crystal clear audio in all environments and is incredibly forgiving when it comes to placement on talent
A foam pop shield is supplied to minimise wind noise and vocal plosives, as well as a durable mounting clip with in-built cable management for quick and easy rigging
body.description: Lavalier GO is a professional-grade wearable microphone designed for use in a wide range of applications. The 3. 5mm TRS connector is designed to pair perfectly with the RØDE Wireless GO and most recording devices with a 3. 5mm TRS microphone input. Lavalier GO is designed to perform excellently in any broadcast application. Featuring a discreet 4. 5mm omnidirectional microphone, it delivers crystal clear audio in all environments and is incredibly forgiving when it comes to placement on talent, allowing for greater flexibility in fast-paced situations. A foam pop shield is supplied to minimise wind noise and vocal plosives (hard ‘b’, ‘t’ and ‘p’ sounds), as well as a durable mounting clip with in-built cable management for quick and easy rigging. It also features a hard-wearing Kevlar reinforced cable, designed to withstand the rigours of any shoot.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Rode Lavalier GO Professional-Grade Wearable Microphone Lavalier GO is a professional wearable microphone designed for a wide range of applications. The 3.5mm TRS connector is designed to pair perfectly with the RØDE Wireless GO and most recording devices with a 3.5mm TRS microphone input. Featuring a discreet 4.5mm omnidirectional microphone, it delivers crystal clear audio in all environments and is incredibly forgiving when it comes to placement on talent, allowing for greater flexibility. The included foam pop shield minimises wind noise and vocal plosives, and the durable mounting clip with cable management allows quick and easy rigging. It also features a hard-wearing Kevlar reinforced cable, designed to withstand the rigours of any shoot. Specifications Acoustic Principle: Permanently Polarised Condenser Polar Pattern: Omni-directional Frequency Range: 20Hz - 20kHz Signal to noise Ratio: 67 dB Equivalent Noise: 27 dB Typical Maximum SPL: 110 dB Dynamic Range: 83dB Typical Output Connection: Gold-plated TRS plug

About Rode Microphones RØDE Microphones are a uniquely Australian owned and operated audio company. Our home is in beautiful Sydney, just 20km west of Sydney's downtown area and right near the home of the Sydney 2000 Olympics. Comprising three warehouses with a total footprint of over 110,000 square feet, the RØDE state-of-the-art plant has over 60 million dollars in precision machinery and an international team of more than 250 people across highly skilled disciplines: electronics engineering, industrial design, technical engineering, robotics, audio and acoustics engineering, metal production, toolmaking, injection-mould technology, logistics, assembly, quality control, finance, marketing and sales. As well as our main campus in Sydney, we have offices in Los Angeles, New York, London, Hong Kong, Shenzhen and Seoul. Our extensive distributor and 6000-strong storefront network ensures RØDE Microphones are sold in 117 countries – and growing – making RØDE a truly global company.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected
reviews.reviewText: I was hesitant to spend so much on a mic, but the cheaper mics just don't hold up. I was pleasantly surprised to see that the cord was only about a meter long. All the cheap mics had 2 meters of wire.The wire is also very thin and I don't know how they managed to shield it from RF and the cladding also contains Kevlar, making it very strong. The sound quality is really good, so if quality is important, this is the mic to have.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound and No Interference
reviews.reviewText: These are just what I needed. Previously I picked up a cheaper set cheap ones pick up a lot of interference. Ill be buying brand name audio gear from now on. Thanks Rode!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Field Mic.
reviews.reviewText: Rode manufactures a great microphone, whether its a wearable lavalier or a vlog microphone (I have both). I have a small Youtube channel about hiking and camping and from time to time, I do interviews with other Youtubers and this lavalier mic has been indispensable! Great sound quality and easy to use. I also have a Rode vlog mic that I mount on my GoPro that I really like. I would definitely recommend buying a Rode!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Goes great with the Wireless Go II ! MUST HAVE!
reviews.reviewText: So I have a RODE wireless go II dual mic set and got one of these lav mics , the clip on is easy to use and the audio is super clear and amazing! Love it! Recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A bit over priced but sounds good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great for its purpose

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Rode product are always great and this is no different. Easy to use and clip on. Had a clean look to it and it picks up very clean audio. Rode products are made in Australia.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Great quality clear audio for anything less than pro broadcast/production. Has some artifacts at highest volume and very minor high db noise. Definitely worth the price point for better than average productions or live events. Excellent budget option.
Didn’t get to use it yet but is the brand I wanted and it should be great quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excelente calidad y relacion precio / beneficio
reviews.reviewText: Excelente calidad y relacion precio / beneficio. Excelente sonido

Si tienes el pack "Wireless Go" (sobre todo el II) ni lo dudes. Déjate de cutreces de grabar con el micro interno del emisor, y usa este solapa profesional.Relación sonido-coste inmejorable, además, se nota que está concebido para ser usado con ese equipo en concreto.Calidad de materiales. Buen sonido y precio más que asequible para un equipo profesional. Ni lo dudes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Leichtes, aber dennoch gut verarbeitetes Mikrofon
reviews.reviewText: Ich habe das Mikrofon zur Verwendung mit dem Rode Wireless Mic II gekauft und bin sehr zufrieden. Die Ansteckklemme hält gut, das Kabel ist leicht aber dennoch hochwertig und die Tonqualität sehr gut.Was das Herausfiltern von Nebengeräuschen angeht, darf man keine Wunder erwarten. Ein Springbrunnen in der Nähe oder Gespräche von umstehenden Personen hört man, wenn auch der Sprecher wesentlich präsenter ist.Ich kann das Mikrofon dennoch empfehlen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These are excellent lapel mics for use with a wireless system. I've bought two for my Comica wireless set, but they work also with other brands. The sound quality is outstanding - a full range with good base and no hiss. Not really possible to tell the difference between these and Sennheiser lapel mics. You can't however say the same for Rode shotgun mics - the Sennheiser options are noticeably more sensitive.The connectors are TRS, so they won't work with a smartphone without a TRS-TRSS adapter (TRSS jacks have an extra ring). So don't buy the later Rode mic if you need a TRS connection for your mixer or camera!
